[b][color=white]Writers Tales Deleted[/color][/b]
On the 26th of July, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced that he had deleted the Writer Tales subforum. This was done due to inactivity in the said section. All threads that were in this sub forum at the time, were moved to the lounge. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5866581] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Responsive Theme[/color][/b]
July 20th, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] made a thread, explaining that he, along with [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][b][color=#9999FF]Xerotic[/color][/b][/url] & [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][b][color=#FFFFFF]iHydra[/color][/b][/url] would be working on a new responsive theme for Hack Forums. The theme will be developed and tested over at [url=https://knotbb.com][b]knot.bb[/b][/url], which is the testing website for HF. You can follow the progress at that site. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5864198] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Anxiety Exposed as Contributing Factor in Anexoria[/color][/b] 
Researchers from the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus conducted a study into the brain's response to Anexoria Nervosa. They began by having diagnosed subjects, as well as a control group, drink sugar water inside an MRI machine. The diagnosed subjects showed a much more fierce response to the sugar. They found that when someone restricts their diet, the neural response to consuming calories amplifies over time. However, the team also found that “But instead of driving eating, we believe it elevates anxiety in anorexia nervosa, which makes them want to restrict more. This becomes then a vicious cycle.” according to Dr. Guido Frank, a professor associated with the study. They believe that behavior associated with the disease could heavily alter neural pathways in the brain. [i][size=x-small][url=https://psychcentral.com/news/2018/07/27/in-anorexia-brains-reward-response-to-taste-tied-to-high-anxiety/137331.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Fatty Acids Found to Improve Relationships[/color][/b] 
Young children that were given omega-3 fatty acid supplements acted out far less than their counterparts, a study out of UMass Lowell finds. These supplements also improve the children's relationship with their parents as a result of being better behaved. The researcher behind the study, Jill Portony, has an interesting theory about these changes “My theory is that a low resting heart rate might be an acquired, adaptive trait: If you are subjected to chronic or frequent stress as a child, you adapt by lowering your heart rate. The lower heart rate protects you by blunting your reaction to stressful events, but it can also lead to stimulation-seeking behavior. In other words, a stressful environment may cause physiological changes that lead to an increase in aggressive and impulsive behavior, in addition to causing the behavior directly,”  While this is all very interesting, it would require far more research to be conducted to land on anything concrete. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.uml.edu/News/press-releases/2018/Omega-3sresearchrelease.aspx]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/lv4d7BY.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Julian Assange to be handed over to UK officials[/color][/b] 
Julian Assange, WikiLeaks founder, had sought out asylum in Ecuador during 2012. Ecuadorian officials plan to withdraw protection for the activist in a deal curated between them and the United Kingdom. Ecuadorian president Lenin Morena met with British representatives on 20 June and discussed a deal where Assange will be released to the United Kingdom in nearly three weeks’ time but can potentially be forced to leave the Ecuadorian Embassy earlier than that. Assange was first on the run when the WikiLeaks founder was accused of sexual assault and rape by Swedish government – that investigation has since then been closed. Assange has stayed in hiding because of the fear of being prosecuted by the United States for releasing classified documents which were provided by former Army officer and fellow activist Chelsea Manning. For the past three months, Julian has been barred from accessing the internet, because of breaching an agreement he and the government had to “not intervene in state affairs.” Moreno proved she is no longer a fan of the activist, saying that Assange is an ‘inherited problem “and a ‘stone in the shoe.’” [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/julian-assange-to-be-handed-over-to-uk-officials-report]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Iran threatens Donald Trump with ‘mother of all wars’ if hostile U.S. policies don’t end[/color][/b] 
Iran president Hassan Rouhani as warned United States President Donald Trump to end the hostile policies toward Iran, otherwise he will introduce ‘the mother of all wars.’ ‘Don’t play with fire, or you will regret,’ the Iranian president exclaimed. He further stated that Iranians are ‘the master’ and they will ‘never bow to anyone.’ Rouhani’s support for Donald Trump is foggy; however, after the outrage that both presidents have been faced with, it seems they are no longer a fan of one another. Hassan went on to state that Washington is ‘intervening across the region,’ additionally “cautioning Trump and U.S. leaders to tread carefully.” Rouhani insinuated that war is not his most preferred method of persuasion, seeing that he “suggested Iran ideally prefers peace.” To Rouhani, the United States’ peace with Iran is the ‘mother of all peace,’ but he continually threatened that they will not back down from war. The Iranian president believes Trump would decide to avert war of any kind, seeing that it is not only bad for business, but because of current domestic and international interests.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.newsweek.com/iran-threatens-donald-trump-mother-all-wars-if-hostile-us-policies-dont-end-1036334]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]
